summaries.novice: Learn the ethical responsibilities and professional boundaries required of an RBT.
summaries.standard: Apply ethics rules related to confidentiality, reporting, supervision, and professional conduct.
summaries.expert: Analyze complex ethical scenarios and respond according to the BACB ethics code and supervision requirements.

novice.question: What is the primary responsibility of an RBT?
novice.answer: To implement behavior plans as written and ensure client safety.

novice.question: RBTs must report ______ incidents of suspected abuse.
True or False: An RBT may accept a $20 gift once per year.
Who creates or modifies behavior plans?
What should an RBT do when unsure about a procedure?
novice.answer: Ask the supervising BCBA for clarification.

novice.question: RBTs must maintain client ______ at all times.
Who analyzes data collected by the RBT?
What should an RBT do if a client is injured?
novice.answer: Report immediately and follow emergency procedures.

novice.question: True or False: Dual relationships are allowed if comfortable.
RBTs must collect data honestly and ______.

standard.question: Which must be reported to the BCBA?
Why must RBTs avoid dual relationships?
Who should be notified if an RBT receives a DUI?
Who is responsible for creating behavior plans?
What role does the RBT have in assessments?
Who decides if a crisis procedure is added?
If data is missed, the RBT should:
Failing to follow a written plan is:

expert.question: Parent asks you to babysit the client.
Client reports abuse at home.
expert.answer: Report immediately to authorities and BCBA

expert.question: Parent asks you to modify the plan.
You collected incorrect data.
expert.explanation: Transparency is required by ethics code.

sections.title: RBT Core Responsibilities
sections.content: RBTs implement plans, collect accurate data, maintain confidentiality, avoid dual relationships, and report important changes to the BCBA.

sections.title: BCBA Responsibilities
sections.content: BCBAs conduct assessments, design and modify programs, analyze data, and supervise RBTs.

sections.title: Confidentiality & Documentation
sections.content: Client information must be protected, and documentation must be accurate, honest, and secure.

sections.title: Dual Relationships & Conflicts of Interest
sections.content: Professionals must avoid dual relationships, inappropriate gifts, and conflicts of interest.
